evidence_items.text: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle. The airfield boundary fence in the Rwy 07 undershoot had also sustained damage. The barbed wire support arm on one fence pole was missing and the wire had been severed in that location.

Safety reporting With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024. In the MOR, the event type was recorded as ‘ Incident.’ Following a review of the report, ASSI reclassified the event as a Serious Incident and notified the AAIB on 6 January 2025.

Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’ Although they were requested from the commander, further details of the occurrence, which could have provided greater insight into the content and context of their 8 November statement, were not provided to the AAIB.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and accessible during the operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs, communication device logs, and eyewitness reports to confirm presence and accessibility

children_spec.statement: Communication devices were operational and available to the crew
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and device functionality tests to verify communication equipment availability

children_spec.statement: Crew members were available and not engaged in conflicting tasks preventing communication
children_spec.test_procedure: Review task assignments and timing to determine if crew members were free to communicate when needed

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control are physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect the aircraft's mechanical control components for presence and physical integrity; absence or damage would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components are free from obstructions or blockages
children_spec.test_procedure: Check for any foreign objects, debris, or damage causing obstruction in control linkages; detection of blockage would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components are properly connected and secured
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify mechanical linkages and fasteners are correctly connected and tightened; loose or disconnected parts would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components operate smoothly without excessive friction or binding
children_spec.test_procedure: Perform functional tests to assess smoothness of mechanical control movement; detection of binding or excessive friction would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Crew members failed to share critical flight information in a timely manner
children_spec.test_procedure: Review cockpit voice recordings and flight data to identify delays or omissions in information exchange

children_spec.statement: Crew did not follow established communication protocols during the flight
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare crew communication against standard operating procedures and checklists

children_spec.statement: There was confusion or misunderstanding among crew members about flight status or actions
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze transcripts and interviews for evidence of misinterpretations or conflicting statements

children_spec.statement: Crew coordination was impaired by external factors such as noise, fatigue, or distractions
children_spec.test_procedure: Assess environmental and physiological conditions affecting crew performance during the flight

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental data (e.g., weather, lighting) was not available at the time of the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Check if environmental data logs or recordings exist for the incident time; absence indicates unavailability

children_spec.statement: Marking information (e.g., signage, runway markings) was not accessible or recorded during the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify if marking documentation or visual records are present for the incident; lack thereof indicates unavailability

children_spec.statement: Communication or data systems failed to provide environmental or marking information when needed
children_spec.test_procedure: Review system logs and communication records to determine if data transmission was interrupted or missing

children_spec.statement: The environmental conditions at the time of the incident match known hazardous conditions that could cause the deficiency
children_spec.test_procedure: Review weather reports, visibility, and other environmental data to confirm if hazardous conditions were present

children_spec.statement: The physical markings or signage relevant to the incident location were missing, incorrect, or inadequate
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records, photographs, and witness statements to verify the status of markings or signage

children_spec.statement: The environmental or marking deficiencies identified are consistent with the key features of the incident timeline and context
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare the identified deficiencies against the incident timeline and context to assess consistency

children_spec.statement: Availability of required pushback equipment at the time of operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check maintenance and operational logs for equipment readiness and downtime records

children_spec.statement: Availability of qualified personnel to perform the pushback procedure
children_spec.test_procedure: Review crew rosters, duty schedules, and training records for personnel presence and qualification

children_spec.statement: Availability of necessary procedural documentation and checklists during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify presence and accessibility of procedural manuals and checklists at the pushback location

children_spec.statement: The pushback procedure deviated from the standard sequence of steps as defined in the operator's manual
children_spec.test_procedure: Review the recorded pushback procedure steps and compare them against the standard operating manual to identify any deviations

children_spec.statement: The timing of pushback actions did not align with the prescribed timing intervals in the procedural guidelines
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze the timestamps of pushback actions and compare them to the expected timing intervals specified in the procedural guidelines

children_spec.statement: Communication protocols during pushback were not followed according to the standard procedures
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine communication logs and recordings during pushback to verify adherence to standard communication protocols

children_spec.statement: The environmental conditions at the time of the incident were not adequately controlled or mitigated
children_spec.test_procedure: Review environmental data logs and reports to verify if conditions such as weather, lighting, or other factors were within acceptable limits

children_spec.statement: Markings relevant to the operation or safety were missing, obscured, or incorrect
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect physical markings and signage records to confirm presence, visibility, and accuracy at the time of the incident

children_spec.statement: The existing environmental or marking deficiencies were not detected or corrected by the safety management system
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine safety audits, maintenance records, and corrective action reports to determine if deficiencies were identified and addressed

node.statement: Communication or data systems failed to provide environmental or marking information when needed

defeaters: Evidence showing failure or unavailability of communication or data systems providing environmental or marking information.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates that communication or data systems failed to provide environmental or marking information when needed; all evidence relates to physical damage and pilot awareness, not system failures.

children_spec.statement: Mechanical failure is consistent with observed damage patterns on the control surfaces
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine control surfaces for damage patterns and compare with known mechanical failure signatures; evidence inconsistent damage patterns would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Control system components show signs of malfunction or wear consistent with failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect control system components for wear, corrosion, or malfunction indicators; absence of such signs would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Flight data and maintenance records indicate prior issues or anomalies with mechanical control systems
children_spec.test_procedure: Review flight data recorder and maintenance logs for anomalies or prior failures; lack of such evidence would lower probability

children_spec.statement: The mechanical control system components show no signs of wear or damage that would cause failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect and test mechanical control components for wear, damage, or malfunction; evidence of such would lower the probability of defeater resistance

children_spec.statement: The control system's mechanical linkages resisted external forces without deformation or failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Apply stress tests or analyze damage patterns to determine if linkages maintained integrity; evidence of deformation or failure would lower defeater resistance

children_spec.statement: No evidence exists of mechanical control system components being overridden or bypassed
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine control system for signs of tampering or bypass; presence of such would reduce defeater resistance

node.statement: Mechanical components required for control are physically present and intact

defeaters: Evidence showing mechanical components were missing or damaged
Evidence confirming mechanical components were physically present and intact
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items addresses the physical presence or intactness of mechanical components required for control.

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control are physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect the aircraft's mechanical control components for presence and physical integrity; absence or damage would lower the probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components are free from obstructions or blockages
children_spec.test_procedure: Check for any physical obstructions or blockages in the mechanical control pathways; detection of obstructions would lower the probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components are capable of moving as intended without binding or excessive friction
children_spec.test_procedure: Perform functional tests to verify free movement of mechanical control parts; evidence of binding or friction would lower the probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components have not suffered from wear or damage that impairs availability
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine components for signs of wear, corrosion, or damage; presence of impairing wear would lower the probability

node.statement: Mechanical components required for control are physically present and intact

assumptions: The frangible light is considered a mechanical component but not part of the aircraft's control system.
No direct evidence was provided about the aircraft's mechanical control components' physical condition.
defeaters: Direct inspection or maintenance records confirming the physical presence and intact condition of mechanical control components.
Pilot or maintenance crew reports indicating mechanical control component status post-incident.

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.
I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence shows the aircraft physically struck and damaged a frangible light on the runway undershoot, indicating some mechanical components were impacted or missing (H1, S2). The commander was unaware of any strike and did not report mechanical control issues (H4, S3). There is no direct evidence that mechanical control components required for control were intact or missing.

children_spec.statement: Crew members failed to share critical information promptly
children_spec.test_procedure: Review communication logs and interview crew to determine if critical information was delayed or omitted

children_spec.statement: Crew did not follow established coordination protocols
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine procedural adherence through flight data and crew statements to identify deviations from coordination protocols

children_spec.statement: Environmental or technical factors interfered with effective communication
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze technical system logs and environmental conditions to detect communication disruptions

node.statement: Crew members were available and not engaged in conflicting tasks preventing communication

defeaters: Evidence showing crew members were busy with other tasks or unavailable would change my mind.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items addresses crew availability or engagement in conflicting tasks preventing communication.
